docs.title: Nexirift Support Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Nexirift support documentation. This is your guide to understanding our community guidelines, legal policies, and how to use our federated social network instance.

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• New Users: Start with our Rules to understand community expectations
  • Privacy Concerns: Review our Privacy Policy
  • Legal Questions: Check our Terms of Service

docs.title: What is Nexirift?
docs.text: Nexirift is a hobby-run, federated social network instance that's part of the Fediverse. We're committed to providing a safe, respectful environment for all community members.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Federated: Connect with users across the Fediverse
  • Community-Focused: Small, personal instance with active moderation
  • Privacy-Respecting: No tracking, analytics, or advertising
  • Non-Commercial: Free service run as a personal project

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
Need assistance? Here are your options:

  • General Questions: support@nexirift.com
  • Moderation Issues: reports@nexirift.com
  • Privacy Concerns: privacy@nexirift.com
  • Appeals: appeals@nexirift.com

docs.title: Community Guidelines
docs.text:
Please familiarize yourself with our community standards:

  1. Treat others with respect - Be kind and considerate
  2. Use content warnings - Help keep the community safe
  3. Respect privacy - Don't share private information
  4. Follow federation etiquette - Respect other instances' rules

For complete guidelines, see our Rules.

Remember: This is a small, hobby-run instance. We rely on community cooperation to maintain a positive environment for everyone.

docs.title: Blocked Instances
docs.text: We block instances that misbehave or are not compliant with our rules. This is to ensure a safe and respectful environment for all community members. Most of these blocked instances come from the Garden Fence - Fediverse Blocklist.

docs.title: What is Nexirift?
docs.text: Nexirift is a small, hobby-run instance of Sharkey that's part of the Fediverse. We provide a free social networking service with a focus on community and privacy.

docs.title: What is the "Fediverse" or "ActivityPub"?
docs.text: The Fediverse is a network of interconnected social media servers that can communicate with each other using open protocols like ActivityPub. This offers a decentralized alternative to centralized social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Threads.

docs.title: Is Nexirift free to use?
docs.text: Yes, Nexirift is completely free. We don't charge fees or accept donations. This is a personal hobby project.

docs.title: Who runs Nexirift?
docs.text: Nexirift is operated as a personal hobby project by an individual in Australia. It's not a commercial service or organization and we do not plan to change this.

docs.title: Can I migrate my account to and from this instance?
docs.text: Yes, you can migrate to or from Nexirift using standard Sharkey migration tools. This allows you to move your followers and following list to another instance.

docs.title: How do I view Twitter accounts and posts?
docs.text: Search for @account_name@bird.makeup (replace account_name with the account name) to view the tweets (it will only show new tweets).

docs.title: How can I view Bluesky accounts and posts?
docs.text: Please follow the instructions here. This is opt-in so you might not be able to view some accounts.

docs.title: How can I view Threads accounts and posts?
docs.text: This is opt-in on the Threads side by the users. After it is enabled, just search for @account_name@threads.net (it might threads.com - replace account_name with the account name) to view the posts.

docs.title: What software does Nexirift use?
docs.text: Nexirift runs on Sharkey, which is open-source social networking software that's part of the ActivityPub federation protocol.

docs.title: What is Sharkey?
docs.text:
Sharkey is a fork of Misskey, a free and open-source social networking software that's part of the ActivityPub federation protocol.

See here for more information.

docs.title: What data do you collect?
docs.text: See our Privacy Policy for complete details about data collection and usage.

docs.title: How do I delete my account?
docs.text: You can delete your account through your account settings. All data will be removed from our servers within 30 days.

docs.title: What happens to my data when I delete my account?
docs.text: We remove all your data from our servers within 30 days, but cannot control copies that may exist on other federated instances where your content was shared.

docs.title: Can I export my data?
docs.text: Yes, Sharkey provides data export functionality. You can download an archive of your posts, media, followers, and other account data.

docs.title: I can't view profiles on a different instance. Why?
docs.text: Our instance has a blocklist of instances that misbehave or are not compliant with our rules. For transparency purposes, we provide a list of blocked instances here.

docs.title: Can I follow users from other instances?
docs.text: Yes! You can follow and interact with users from other Sharkey instances and compatible platforms like Pleroma, PeerTube, and others.

docs.title: Why can't I see some posts from other instances?
docs.text: Some instances may be blocked or limited due to moderation policies. Content may also be filtered based on your personal settings.

docs.title: How do I report problematic content?
docs.text: Use the built-in report feature (three dots menu on any post) or email reports@nexirift.com.

docs.title: What are content warnings?
docs.text: Content warnings (CW) are a way to hide potentially sensitive content behind a warning label. Users can choose whether to view the content.

docs.title: Can I appeal moderation decisions?
docs.text: Yes, you can appeal moderation decisions by contacting appeals@nexirift.com within 30 days of the action.

docs.title: How do I block or mute someone?
docs.text: You can block or mute users through their profile page or by using the three dots menu on their posts. Blocking prevents all interaction, while muting hides their posts from your timeline.

docs.title: Can I change my username?
docs.text: Usernames cannot be changed on Sharkey. If you need a different username, you'll need to create a new account and migrate your followers.

docs.title: How do I verify my identity?
docs.text:
Sharkey supports link verification through the rel="me" standard. Add links to your other profiles in your bio with the proper rel="me" attribute, and they'll display as verified.

Our instance also offers individual verification for eligible users, though applications are not currently open.

docs.title: What if I forget my password?
docs.text: Use the password reset feature on the login page. You'll receive an email with instructions to reset your password.

docs.title: Still Have Questions?
docs.text:
If you can't find the answer to your question here, feel free to contact us:

  • General Support: support@nexirift.com
  • Moderation Issues: reports@nexirift.com
  • Privacy Concerns: privacy@nexirift.com
  • Appeals: appeals@nexirift.com

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to Nexirift! This guide will help you get started with our federated social network.

docs.title: Creating Your Account
docs.text:
Username

You cannot change your username once you've created your account due to technical limitations.

  1. Visit the Nexirift instance
  2. Click "Sign up"
  3. Choose a username and provide an email address
  4. Verify your email address
  5. Complete your profile

docs.title: Understanding Federation
docs.text: Nexirift is part of the Fediverse, which means you can interact with users from other compatible social networks.

docs.title: What this means for you:
docs.text:
• Your public posts may be visible on other instances
  • You can follow users from other Fediverse platforms
  • Your data may be stored on multiple servers

Federation Benefits

Federation allows you to connect with a much larger community while still enjoying the benefits of a small, well-moderated instance.

docs.title: First Steps
docs.text:
1. Read the Rules: Familiarize yourself with our community guidelines
  2. Set up your profile: Add a bio, avatar, and header image
  3. Configure privacy settings: Choose who can see your posts
  4. Find people to follow: Explore the federated timeline

docs.title: Post Visibility Options
docs.text:
• Public: Visible to everyone, appears on public timelines
  • Unlisted: Visible to everyone but doesn't appear on public timelines
  • Followers-only: Only visible to your followers
  • Direct: Only visible to mentioned users (like a direct message)

docs.title: Profile Privacy
docs.text: You can also set your entire account to be private, requiring approval for new followers.

docs.title: Content Warnings
docs.text:
Content warnings (CW) help create a safer space for everyone. Use them for:

  • Sensitive topics (politics, mental health, etc.)
  • Spoilers for media
  • Eye contact in photos
  • Potentially disturbing content

docs.title: Community Etiquette
docs.text:
• Use Alt Text: Describe images for accessibility
  • Be Respectful: Treat others as you'd like to be treated
  • Respect Boundaries: Pay attention to bios and pinned posts
  • Use Content Warnings: Help others curate their experience

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: If you need assistance, contact support@nexirift.com.

docs.title: Useful Links
docs.text:

  • Privacy Policy
  • Terms of Service
  • Frequently Asked Questions

docs.title: Roles
docs.text: Nexirift implements multiple roles for different types of users. Some of these roles are strictly just for verification while others have some additional perks.

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
Roles that are strictly for verification purposes are:

Notable Organization Public figures, creators, and influencers Businesses, brands, and non-profit entities

docs.title: Nexirift
docs.text:
Roles that are for Nexirift staff are:

TO-DO

docs.title: Rules
docs.text:
Last Updated: 16 October 2025

Welcome to Nexirift! These rules ensure a safe, respectful environment for all community members. By using this instance, you agree to follow these guidelines.

docs.title: Community Guidelines
docs.text: Please refrain from reporting content that does not break these rules just because you don't like the person who posted it.

docs.title: 1. Treat Others with Respect
docs.text:
• Be kind, courteous, and considerate in all interactions
  • Respect diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and identities
  • Engage in good faith discussions and constructive dialogue
  • Remember there are real people behind every account

docs.title: 2. Content Warnings and Sensitivity
docs.text:
• Use content warnings (CW) for potentially sensitive material including:
  • Mental health discussions
  • Political content
  • Violence or disturbing imagery
  • Adult content or nudity
  • Food images (for those with eating disorders)
  • Flashing/strobing media (epilepsy risk)

docs.title: 3. Accessibility
docs.text:
These "rules" are optional, however, we recommend adhering to them to ensure a positive experience for all users.

  • Add alt text to images when possible
  • Use CamelCase for hashtags (e.g., #MyHashTag)
  • Avoid excessive emoji or special characters in display names

docs.title: Absolutely Prohibited
docs.text:
The following behaviors will result in immediate action:

  • Harassment, bullying, or targeted abuse
  • Hate speech based on identity, religion, race, gender, sexuality, or disability
  • Doxxing or sharing private personal information
  • Spam or excessive self-promotion under other people's accounts
  • Impersonation of others without clear parody/fan account indicators
  • Misinformation that could cause harm (health, safety, elections)
  • Highly illegal content such as child pornography

docs.title: Sexual Content Restrictions
docs.text:
• No sexual content involving minors (zero tolerance)
  • Adult content must use appropriate content warnings
  • Explicit material should be marked as sensitive
  • No unsolicited sexual content in public timelines

docs.title: Violence and Extremism
docs.text:
• No content promoting violence against individuals or groups
  • No extremist ideology or terrorist content
  • No graphic violence without appropriate warnings
  • No content glorifying self-harm

docs.title: Federation Etiquette
docs.text:
• Respect the rules of other instances when interacting
  • Don't engage in cross-instance drama or harassment
  • Report problematic federated content rather than engaging

docs.title: Account Guidelines
docs.text:
• Choose appropriate usernames (no offensive language)
  • Keep display names readable and non-disruptive

docs.title: Privacy and Consent
docs.text:
• Respect others' privacy settings and boundaries
  • Don't screenshot private conversations without consent
  • Respect when someone asks not to be mentioned or tagged

docs.title: Enforcement Actions
docs.text:
Depending on severity and context, violations may result in:

  1. Informal warning - Direct message explaining the issue
  2. Formal warning - Recorded warning with explanation
  3. Content removal - Specific posts deleted
  4. Temporary silence - Limited posting ability (1-7 days)
  5. Temporary suspension - Account disabled (1-30 days)
  6. Permanent ban - Account terminated

docs.title: Appeals Process
docs.text:
• Contact appeals@nexirift.com within 30 days of action
  • Send from the same email address as your account
  • Include your username and reason for appeal
  • Decisions on serious violations (harassment, illegal content) are generally final
  • Appeals are reviewed within 7-14 business days

docs.title: Reporting
docs.text:
Report problematic content or behavior by:

  • Using the built-in report feature
  • Emailing reports@nexirift.com with details
  • Including screenshots or links when helpful

docs.title: Bot Accounts
docs.text:
• Clearly mark bot accounts in bio and display name
  • Bots must follow all community rules
  • Automated posting should not spam timelines
  • Register with administrators for high-volume bots

docs.title: Instance Defederation
docs.text:
We may limit or block instances that:

  • Allow prohibited content consistently
  • Have inadequate moderation policies
  • Engage in coordinated harassment
  • Violate our community values

docs.title: Administrator Discretion
docs.text:
Moderators and administrators reserve the right to:

  • Interpret rules based on context and intent
  • Take action on behavior that disrupts community harmony
  • Make decisions about edge cases not explicitly covered
  • Modify rules with appropriate notice

docs.title: Contact and Questions
docs.text:
• Moderation Issues: moderation@nexirift.com
  • General Questions: support@nexirift.com
  • Appeals: appeals@nexirift.com

These rules apply to all content and interactions on Nexirift. Questions about specific situations? Contact our moderation team.

docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.text:
Last Updated: 16 October 2025

This Privacy Policy explains how Nexirift (the "Service") collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our federated social network instance.

docs.title: Account Information
docs.text:
• Username and display name
  • Email address (for account verification and essential communications)
  • Profile information you choose to share (bio, avatar, header image)
